# Create questionnaire {background-color=var(--s1)}

## Create questionnaire {.t1}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/create_questionnaire.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Click on `CREATE NEW`
- Fill the required fields:  
    - `Questionnaire title`. Name users see.
    - `Questionnaire variable`. Name system uses. See more [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/components/questionnaire-variable/).
- Click on `CREATE`.

:::

::::

::: {.notes}

### `Questionnaire title`

How the questionnaire will be seen

- In Designer, by developers
- In HQ, by survey managers
- In Interviewer, by interivewers

### `Questionnaire variable`

Name used for main data file

:::

# Add questions {background-color=var(--s2)}

## Add questions {.t2}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/add_questions.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

### Two methods

1. Click `ADD QUESTION` button
1. Select `Add question after` from the right-click menu

:::

::::

::: {.notes}

While both methods add a question, they are subtly different:

- `ADD QUESTION` adds a question at the end of the list of objects.
- `Add question after` inserts a question where the user right-clicks

Choose the best method for the job.

See docs [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/components/create-and-modify-components-/#Create)

:::

### Deconstruct PAPI

### Deconstruct PAPI

- When choosing SuSo type, there may be a few options. Choose the one that best fits the need.
- When identifying SuSo components:
    - Look at the PAPI components
    - Determine which of them belong where in SuSo
    - Order may be different in SuSo

### Construct CAPI

Mostly copy-paste

# Copy/paste and move questions {background-color=var(--s4)}
:::

## Copy/paste {.t4}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/copy_and_paste.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

### Copy

- Right-click
- Select `Copy`

### Paste

Two methods:

- Press `PASTE` button
- Select `Paste after` from the right-click menu

:::

::::

::: {.notes}

### Copy

Note: SuSo keeps copied object in the "clipboard". No real need to copy again. Done in slides for purely pedagogical purposes.

### Paste

As with creating questions, there is a subtle difference between the two methods

- `PASTE` adds to the end of the object list
- `Paste after` inserts after where the user right-clicks

:::

## Move {.t4}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/move.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Find a question
- Move to the left-hand margin until the cursor becomes `r fontawesome::fa(name = "up-down-left-right")`
- Click and drag question to desired location

:::

::::


# Test questionnaire {background-color=var(--s5)}

## Test questionnaire {.t5}

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="70%"}
![](assets/test.mp4){fig-align="center"}
:::

::: {.column width="30%"}

- Click on `TEST`
    - If there are errors, Designer will provide a list. See more [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/messages/compile_errors/).
    - If no errors, Designer will open a web-based tester in a new web browser tab. See more [here](https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/questionnaire-designer/testing/testing-your-questionnaire-with-the-online-tester/).
- Update the version of the questionnaire being tested by clicking `r fontawesome::fa(name = "down-long")``r fontawesome::fa(name = "up-long")`

:::

::::
